how_it_works.title: How does A11i Detector work?
how_it_works.subtitle: Simple and efficient process to detect accessibility issues

1.title: Run the analysis from your browser
1.description: Install the A11i Detector extension and run accessibility tests on the current URL or a specific section of the page.
features: Select which test suite to run
Launch analysis on real pages as users see them
Start executions in production environment
1.note: The analysis runs automatically and in parallel, depending on the page complexity.

2.title: Review and manage results in the Dashboard
2.description: Once execution is complete, results are available in the A11i Detector Dashboard.
features: View and download all your accessibility reports
Filter executions by date and URL
Search reports by URL, status or date
Quickly identify analysis status and QA status
Access details of each execution from the results table
2.note: The Dashboard acts as a centralized repository of analyses, avoiding loss of results and facilitating tracking over time.

3.title: Analyze report details and download results
3.description: From each report's details you can manage issues and generate final reports.
features: Review each detected issue with visual evidence
Navigate directly to the affected element on the page
Add notes and manage issue status
Discard false positives before generating final report
Download report ready to work with development, QA or accessibility teams
3.note: This approach allows transforming automatic scanning into actionable and refined output, aligned with real workflow processes.

notifications.title: Real-time notifications

faq.title: Frequently Asked Questions
faq.subtitle: Answers to the most common questions about A11i Detector

items.question: Does A11i Detector replace manual auditing?
items.answer: No, A11i Detector is a complementary tool. It automates detection of 70% of the most common issues, but expert manual audits remain essential for complex cases and final validation.

items.question: What level of coverage does it offer?
items.answer: A11i Detector covers more than 70% of the most frequent accessibility issues according to WCAG 2.1 Level AA guidelines, including keyboard, focus, contrast, images, navigation and responsive design.

items.question: On which pages can I run the analysis?
items.answer: You can run analyses on any public URL accessible from the internet. The extension works on complete web pages or specific sections you select manually.

items.question: How long does an analysis take?
items.answer: Time varies depending on page complexity (20-30 minutes typical). Factors such as number of interactive elements, images and dynamic content affect duration.

items.question: Can I review and filter results before downloading them?
items.answer: Yes, the Dashboard allows you to review all detected issues, filter by severity, type or URL, add notes, mark false positives and manage status before generating the final report.

items.question: Which browsers are compatible?
items.answer: The extension is available for Chrome and Firefox. The Dashboard works in any modern browser with internet connection.

items.question: Is the Dashboard included?
items.answer: Yes, access includes both the browser extension and complete Dashboard for result management, historical reports and team collaboration.
